GlobalVariables.StudyDescription: CDISC Test Study Modified to illustrate Define-XML 2.1 features

MetaDataVersion.Name: Study CDISC01_1, Data Definitions V-1
MetaDataVersion.Description: Data Definitions for CDISC01-01 SDTM datasets. This metadata version contains only a subset of datasets compared to the prior version. The metadata provided is only intended to illustrate most Define-XML 2.1 new features and not meant to serve as a comprehensive example of all metadata expected to be defined to fully describe an SDTM dataset package. Notes: 1) Supplemental documents released in prior Define-XML versions were not updated to reflect changes to the metadata. 2) This example is prepared for a context other than submission; however, still using the approach of non-standard variables prepared as supplemental qualifiers datasets.

ItemGroupDef.Name: TS
ItemGroupDef.def:Structure: One record per trial summary parameter value

ItemGroupDef.Name: DI
ItemGroupDef.def:Structure: One record per device identifier per device

ItemGroupDef.Name: EC
ItemGroupDef.def:Structure: One record per constant dosing interval per subject

ItemGroupDef.Name: EX
ItemGroupDef.def:Structure: One record per constant dosing interval per subject

ItemGroupDef.Name: LB
ItemGroupDef.def:Structure: One record per analyte per visit per subject

ItemGroupDef.Name: VS
ItemGroupDef.def:Structure: One record per vital sign measurement per visit per subject

ItemGroupDef.Name: XS
ItemGroupDef.def:Structure: One record per finding per visit per subject

ItemGroupDef.Name: XX
ItemGroupDef.def:Structure: One record per finding per visit per subject

ItemGroupDef.Name: SUPPDM
ItemGroupDef.def:Structure: One record per IDVAR, IDVARVAL, and QNAM value per subject

ItemGroupDef.Name: SUPPVS
ItemGroupDef.def:Structure: One record per IDVAR, IDVARVAL, and QNAM value per subject

CodeList.Name: Units for Vital Signs Orig Results

Description.TranslatedText:
Age at Screening Date (Screening Date - Birth date).
For the complete algorithm see the referenced external document.

FormalExpression.Context: SAS 9.0 or later as a macro call. Macro developed as a standard macro that returns a value to be assigned as part of a data step assignment or proc sql select and update statements. Notes: 1) need to be able to specify more information about the context of a method, the method version and corresponding input parameters. For ODMv1.3.2 / Define-XML 2.1 free-text. 2) As an example, included a version of the code handled on the macro name as it can be defined by the user somehwere in the metadata definition for the method to be used.
SAS 9.0 or later using a SAS Base function, asuming no restriction on length and decimal places
R version xyz, using a generic method asuming no restriction on length and decimal places

Description.TranslatedText:
round((VSSTRESN for weight/ (VSSTRESN for height / 100)^2), .01).
Note: height and weight at the closest visit collected.

FormalExpression.Context: SAS 9.0 or later as a macro call. Macro developed as a standard macro that returns a value to be assigned as part of a data step assignment or proc sql select and update statements. Notes: 1) need to be able to specify more information about the context of a method, the method version and corresponding input parameters. For ODMv1.3.2 / Define-XML 2.1 free-text. 2) As an example, included a version of the code handled on the macro name as it can be defined by the user somehwere in the metadata definition for the method to be used.

SAS 9.0 or later as a macro call. Macro developed as a standard macro that returns a value to be assigned as part of a data step assignment or proc sql select and update statements. Notes: 1) need to be able to specify more information about the context of a method, the method version and corresponding input parameters. For ODMv1.3.2 / Define-XML 2.1 free-text. 2) As an example, included a version of the code handled on the macro name as it can be defined by the user somehwere in the metadata definition for the method to be used.

Description.TranslatedText: Only created if value qualifies as potentially clinically significant high or low based on the high and low ranges specified in the Statistical Analysis Plan.
ECENDY = ECENDTC-RFSTDTC+1 if ECENDTC is on or after RFSTDTC. ECENDTC - RFSTDTC if ECENDTC precedes RFSTDTC.

If ARMCD=WONDER10 then EXDOSE = Number of Tablets per Day (QVAL where QNAM=SMNO) * 10. If ARMCD=WONDER20 then EXDOSE = Number of Tablets per Day (QVAL where QNAM=SMNO) * 20. If ARMCD=PLACEBO then EXDOSE = 0.
Derived from ARM, ARMCD - equal to mg
EXENDY = EXENDTC-RFSTDTC+1 if EXENDTC is on or after RFSTDTC. EXENDTC - RFSTDTC if EXENDTC precedes RFSTDTC.
EXSTDY = EXSTDTC - RFSTDTC+1 if EXSTDTC is on or after RFSTDTC. EXSTDTC - RFSTDTC if EXSTDTC precedes RFSTDTC.
Safety subjects only: LBBLFL = "Y" for last record with non Null LBORRES on or before the first dose date (RFSTDTC). Null otherwise.
LBDY = LBDTC-RFSTDTC+1 if LBDTC is on or after RFSTDTC. LBDTC - RFSTDTC if LBDTC precedes RFSTDTC.
Reference Range Indicator based upon standard results and ranges.
Selected value converted to upper case to match CT.
Domain abbreviation from where data originated.
RFENDTC = termination date, for safety subjects. Null for screen failures.
RFSTDTC = first date/time of study drug, for safety subject. Null for screen failures.

MethodDef.Name: Algorithm to derive the SAFETY population flag

Description.TranslatedText: SAFETY = "Y" for randomized subjects who took at least one dose study medication. Null otherwise.
Sequential number identifying records within each USUBJID in the domain.
Sequential number identifying records within each TSPARM in the domain.
Safety subjects only: VSBLFL = "Y" for last record with non Null VSORRES on or before the first dose date (RFSTDTC). Null otherwise.
VSDY = VSDTC-RFSTDTC+1 if VSDTC is on or after RFSTDTC. VSDTC - RFSTDTC if VSDTC precedes RFSTDTC.
Data collected in non-standard units (i.e. lbs, inches) is converted using standard conversion factors to standard units (kg, cm).
VSSTRESN = numeric value of VSSTRESC, when VSSTRESC contains numeric data.
Safety subjects only: XSBLFL = "Y" for last record with non Null XSORRES on or before the first dose date (RFSTDTC). Null otherwise.
XSDY = XSDTC-RFSTDTC+1 if XSDTC is on or after RFSTDTC. XSDTC - RFSTDTC if XSDTC precedes RFSTDTC.

Data collected in non-standard units (i.e. lbs, inches) is converted using standard conversion factors to standard units (kg, cm).
BMI is calculated by the EDC system (operationally derived) as follows: round((XSSTRESN for weight/ (XSSTRESN for height / 100)^2), .01).
Note: If height is not collected at a visit, use the height collected at screening.
XSSTRESN = numeric value of XSSTRESC, when XSSTRESC contains numeric data.
Safety subjects only: XXBLFL = "Y" for last record with non Null XXORRES on or before the first dose date (RFSTDTC). Null otherwise.
XXDY = XXDTC-RFSTDTC+1 if XXDTC is on or after RFSTDTC. XXDTC - RFSTDTC if XXDTC precedes RFSTDTC.

Data collected in non-standard units (i.e. lbs, inches) is converted using standard conversion factors to standard units (kg, cm).
BMI is calculated by the EDC system (operationally derived) as follows: round((XXSTRESN for weight/ (XXSTRESN for height / 100)^2), .01).
Note: If height is not collected at a visit, use the height collected at screening.
XXSTRESN = numeric value of XXSTRESC, when XXSTRESC contains numeric data.
Assigned from TA.ARM based on ARMCD.
Assigned based on Randomization Number. See Note 2.1
This is a subset of the ISO-3166 (Country Codes) codelist
Assuming the CT was not upversioned for this study
The CT version applicable for the new Domain is the 2015-12-18 version
The Domain codelist was updated when SDTMIG 3.2 became production. Referencing a newer CT version that includes the revised codelist

The term "UN" was changed to "UNDIFERENTIATED" for codelist "SEX" on the 2014-03-28 CT release. Referencing the codelist from a newer release since the new release includes other codelists used in the study.
The DI domain is included to illustrate the use of a separate complementary SDTMIG. In this example, the device ID is referenced from a Findings Domain (XS).
Name of the variables for the related records.
Value of identifying variable described in IDVAR.
The code values used are the Alpha-3 codes
Assuming the LBNRIND is derived by the vendor
Origin specified at Value Level Metadata
Note this example does not include VLM for this variable since it is just an example and the way to specify VLM is illustrated for LBORRESU.
Note that the study protocol has been amended to not allow the specification of other race per current regulatory requirements. Refer to FDA Guidance XYZ and PMDA Guidance P-XYZ.
Planned Numeric tests were not performed.
The CDISC01 study was modeled on a very old SDTMIG and no attempt was done yet to upversion it to a newer SDTMIG
As an example, the CDISC01 study was adjusted to include a new Domain available in SDTM IG 3.2
As an example, the CDISC01 study was adjusted to include a new Domain available in SDTMIG-MD 1.0. The XS Domain is expected to reference the device used with variable SPDEVID.
The data submitted only includes subjects in the USA since other sites did not enroll any subjects.

Join any Subject Level dataset with the Demographics dataset based on [IG.datasetname]IT.USUBJID = [IG.DM]IT.USUBJID, assuming 'IG.datasetname' is the OID of the ItemGroupDef that defines the subject-level dataset to be joined with the Demographics dataset.
Assigned from the TV domain based on the VISIT
Testing a comment in addition to a method: BMI is derived and the specific method is provided at VLM
Testing a comment in addition to a method: BMI is operationally derived and the specific method is provided at VLM
Standard units consistent with CDISC controlled terminology
Special domain contingent on rare conditions observed.
